meta.content: initial-scale = 1.0, maximum-scale = 1.0, user-scalable = no, width = device-width

div.p: Greetings, and welcome to the digital front door of the Panhandle Community School District. The district as a whole encompasses 170 square miles of Central Illinois and is made up of the communities of Farmersville, Harvel, Raymond, and Waggoner. Panhandle prides itself on having good schools and good students. Our mission is to develop lifelong learners, which starts with our youngest learners beginning their education in our Panhandle Preschool for All program, and extends to our most advanced learners taking weighted classes at the high school level. Our curriculum throughout the district stresses the development of strong English language arts and mathematical skills, the opportunity to expand student understanding of science and the humanities, the expansion of technological skills, and the development of student physical fitness throughout their school career. As superintendent of the Panhandle School District, I hope that all who visit our schools and our digital environments feel connected to our school district and our communities as a whole. Should you need individual assistance regarding one of our schools or our educational opportunities, please contact the school directly through the school’s webpage or contact me directly at ahopper@panhandleschools.com.

Aaron Hopper, Superintendent
Panhandle Community Unit School District #2
Twitter: @PCUSD2_Sup
Facebook: Panhandle CUSD2
